conclusion: To determine the state of the elevator at t = 4.5 seconds, analyze the acceleration at that time.
Weightlessness occurs when the elevator accelerates downward, decreasing apparent weight. Acceleration is negative.
Overload (superweight) occurs when the elevator accelerates upward, increasing apparent weight. Acceleration is positive.
The graph shows acceleration a of the elevator as a function of time t.
Between t = 4 seconds and t = 5 seconds, acceleration a is positive and constant at 2 m/s².

premise: Acceleration at t = 4.5 seconds is positive (2 m/s²).

conclusion: At t = 4.5 seconds, the elevator is in a state of overload (superweight).
